meanings.definition: Lack of concern or care; indifference.
meanings.sent1: Her insouciance towards the upcoming exam surprised her classmates.
meanings.sent2: His insouciance about the situation made others question his commitment.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insouciance, he managed to ace the test effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The insouciance of the cat as it knocked over the vase was almost comical.
meanings.sent5: The insouciance of the toddler as he played with his toys was a joy to watch.

meanings.sent1: She maintained an air of insouciance even in stressful situations.
meanings.sent2: His insouciance in the face of criticism was admirable.
meanings.sent3: The insouciance with which she shrugged off the insult left him speechless.
meanings.sent4: Her insouciance was like a shield against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The insouciance in his tone belied the seriousness of the matter.

meanings.sent1: Their insouciance during the picnic brought a sense of relaxation to the group.
meanings.sent2: The children's insouciance as they played in the park was infectious.
meanings.sent3: The insouciance with which he danced in the rain lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent4: Her insouciance was like a breath of fresh air in the stuffy room.
meanings.sent5: The insouciance of the puppy as it chased its tail was endearing.
